div.p: F74/3221, unit 737, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

In compliance with the request, conveyed in your letter of the 5th March,
See T. Ware to M, 5 March 1874. I have the honor to transmit now herewith an estimate of the expenditure, which would be required for my Department during the coming financial year. I have deemed it my duty to provide fully for the efficient services of the institution under my control, but of course it is left to the consideration of the honorable the Chief Secretary, whether all the items recommended by me should be adopted. On comparison with the provision made for other scientific Departments it will be observed, that the permanent working fund deemed necessary by me is moderate, considering the multifarious information expected from my services, and considering that the Government is sure to desire a service advantageous to the country and honorable to myself. Should any special information yet be needed on any of the items, then I will not fail to afford it.
